00146 const SDMMC004_CommandType SDMMC004_Command[40] =
00147 {
00148     /* SD  Card Commands */
00149     { 0,0,0,0,0,0,SDMMC004_GO_IDLE_STATE,0 },     /*0*/
00150     { 1,0,1,0,0,0,SDMMC004_ALL_SEND_CID,0 },      /*1*/
00151     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SEND_RELATIVE_ADDR,0}, /*2*/
00152     { 0,0,0,0,0,0,SDMMC004_SET_DSR,0 },           /*3*/
00153     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_SWITCH_FUNC,0},        /*4*/
00154     { 3,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SELECT_DESELECT_CARD,0},/*5*/
00155     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SD_SEND_IF_COND,0},    /*6*/
00156     { 1,0,1,0,0,0,SDMMC004_SEND_CSD,0},           /*7*/
00157     { 1,0,1,0,0,0,SDMMC004_SEND_CID,0},           /*8*/
00158     { 3,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_STOP_TRANSMISSION,0},  /*9*/
00159     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SEND_STATUS,0 },       /*10*/
00160     { 0,0,0,0,0,0,SDMMC004_GO_INACTIVE_STATE,0},  /*11*/
00161     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SET_BLOCKLEN,0},       /*12*/
00162     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_READ_SINGLE_BLOCK,0},  /*13*/
00163     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_READ_MULTIPLE_BLOCK,0},/*14*/
00164     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_WRITE_BLOCK,0 },       /*15*/
00165     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_WRITE_MULTIPLE_BLOCK,0},/*16*/
00166     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_PROGRAM_CSD,0},        /*17*/
00167     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SET_WRITE_PROT,0},     /*18*/
00168     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_CLR_WRITE_PROT,0},     /*19*/
00169     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_SEND_WRITE_PROT,0},    /*20*/
00170     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_ERASE_WR_BLK_START,0}, /*21*/
00171     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_ERASE_WR_BLK_END,0},   /*22*/
00172     { 3,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_ERASE,0},              /*23*/
00173     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_LOCK_UNLOCK,0},        /*24*/
00174     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_APP_CMD,0},            /*25*/
00175     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_GEN_CMD,0},            /*26*/
00176     /*  End of SD card commands */
00177     /* Start of Application Specific commands */
00178     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SET_BUS_WIDTH,0},      /*27*/
00179     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_SD_STATUS,0},          /*28*/
00180     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_SEND_NUM_WR_BLOCKS,0}, /*29*/

00184     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_SEND_SCR,0 },          /*33*/

00187     { 2,0,0,1,0,0,SDMMC004_MMC_SEND_OP_COND,0},   /*34*/

00189     { 3,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SWITCH_FUNC,0},        /*36*/

00192     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_ERASE_GROUP_END,0},    /*39*/
00193     /* End of SDMMC_MMC  Card specific commands */

00202     0, 0xFF,1,2,3,0xFF,4,5,6,7,8,0xFF,9,10,0xFF,\
00203     11, 12, 13, 14,0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF,\
00204     15, 16, 0xFF, 17, 18, 19, 20, 0xFF, 21, 22,\
00205     0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 23, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF,\
00206     24, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF,\
00207     0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 25, 26, 0xFF, \
00208     27, 28, 29,30,31,32,33
00209 };

00223 /*******************************************************************************

00226 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_1>>> */
00227 /*
00228  * This function resets the Host Controller's register depending on the
00229  * parameter passed.
00230  */
00231 status_t SDMMC004_lReset( uint8_t Reset )
00232 {
00233   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00234 
00235   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00236   SDMMC->SW_RESET =  (SDMMC->SW_RESET | Reset);
00237   /* The Host Controller takes some time to complete software reset*/
00238   osDelay(SDMMC004_RESET_DELAY);
00239   if (SDMMC->SW_RESET & Reset)
00240   {
00241     Status = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00242   }
00243   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00244   return Status;
00245 }
00246 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_2>>> */
00247 /*
00248  * This function clears the card related structures and stops the SD clock.
00249  */
00250 void SDMMC004_lCardCleanUp()
00251 {
00252   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00253   memset((void*)&SDMMC004_CardInfo,0,sizeof(SDMMC004_CardInfo));
00254   SDMMC004_Handle.CardType = 0;
00255   SDMMC004_Handle.f8 = 0;
00256   SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00257   SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00258   SDMMC004_Handle.ErrorRecoveryStatus = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00259   SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00260   SDMMC004_Handle.State  = 0;
00261   /* Stop the SD Clock Enable */
00262   CLR_BIT( SDMMC->CLOCK_CTRL,SDMMC_CLOCK_CTRL_SDCLOCK_EN_Pos  );
00263   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00264 }
00265 
00266 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3>>> */
00267 /*
00268  * This function checks whether the CMD and DATA lines are free before issuing
00269  * any command.
00270  */
00271 status_t SDMMC004_lCheckDatCmdline(const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr)
00272 {
00273   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00274   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00275   do
00276   {
00277 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00278     if( Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataCmdLineBusy == TRUE)
00279     {
00280       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CMD_LINE_BUSY;
00281       break;
00282     }
00283 #endif
00284     /* Read from Present state register to Check Cmd line is free */
00285     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3_1>>> */
00286     if ( SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_COMMAND_INHIBIT_CMD_Msk)
00287     {
00288       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CMD_LINE_BUSY;
00289       break;
00290     }
00291     /* Check for  data line for Send Status command  and all those commands using
00292    data line */
00293     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3_2>>> */
00294     if (( 1UL == CommandPtr->DataPresentSelect) ||  \
00295         ( (SDMMC004_SEND_STATUS == CommandPtr->CommandIndex) || \
00296             (3UL == CommandPtr->ResponseTypeSelect) )
00297        )
00298     {
00299       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3_3>>> */
00300       /* Read from Present state register to Check data line is free */
00301       if ( (SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_COMMAND_INHIBIT_DAT_Msk )!= 0)
00302       {
00303         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_DATA_LINE_BUSY;
00304         break;
00305       }
00306       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3_4>>> */
00307       else
00308       {
00309         /* Update the data line state to active */
00310         if( (1UL == CommandPtr->DataPresentSelect) ||
00311             (3UL == CommandPtr->ResponseTypeSelect) )
00312         {
00313           SDMMC004_Handle.State |=(uint32_t)SDMMC004_STATE_DATA_ACTIVE;
00314         }
00315       }
00316     }
00317     /* Update the Command line state to active */
00318     SDMMC004_Handle.State |=(uint32_t)SDMMC004_STATE_CMD_ACTIVE;
00319   } while(0);
00320   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00321   return Status;
00322 }
00323 
00324 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4>>> */
00325 /*
00326  * This function checks response error types in Command's Arguments category
00327  */
00328 void SDMMC004_lCheckArgumentError
00329 (
00330   const uint32_t  *CardStatusPtr,
00331   uint8_t *ErrorPtr
00332 )
00333 {
00334   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00335   /* The command's argument was out of the allowed range for this card.*/
00336   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4_1>>> */
00337   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_OUT_OF_RANGE_BITMASK ) != 0)
00338   {
00339     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00340     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, SDMMC004_OUT_OF_RANGE_ERROR,0,NULL);
00341   } /*End of "if( *CardStatusPtr & CSR_OUT_OF_RANGE_BITMASK ) "*/
00342 
00343   /* A mis-aligned address which did not match the block length was used in
00344    * the command.*/
00345   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4_2>>> */
00346   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ADDRESS_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00347   {
00348     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00349     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, SDMMC004_ADDRESS_ERROR,0,NULL);
00350   } /*End of " if ( *CardStatusPtr & CSR_ADDRESS_ERROR_BITMASK) "*/
00351 
00352   /* The transferred block length is not allowed for this card, or the number
00353    * of transferred bytes does not match the block length.*/
00354   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4_3>>> */
00355   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_BLOCK_LEN_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00356   {
00357     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00358     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_BLOCK_LEN_ERROR,0,NULL);
00359   }/*End of " if (*CardStatusPtr & CSR_BLOCK_LEN_ERROR_BITMASK) "*/
00360 
00361   /* Set when the host attempts to write to a protected block or to the
00362      temporary or permanent write protected card.*/
00363   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4_4>>> */
00364   if (( *CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_WP_VIOLATION_BITMASK ) != 0)
00365   {
00366     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00367     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_WP_VIOLATION_ERROR,0,NULL);
00368   }/*End of "if ( *CardStatusPtr & CSR_WP_VIOLATION_BITMASK ) "*/
00369   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00370 }
00371 
00372 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_5>>> */
00373 /*
00374  * This function checks response error types in Erase category
00375  */
00376 void SDMMC004_lCheckEraseError
00377 (
00378     const uint32_t *CardStatusPtr,
00379     uint8_t *ErrorPtr
00380 )
00381 {
00382   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00383   /* An error in the sequence of erase commands occurred.*/
00384   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_5_1>>> */
00385   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ERASE_SEQ_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00386   {
00387     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00388     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_ERASE_SEQ_ERROR,0,NULL);
00389   }
00390   /* An invalid selection of write-blocks for erase occurred.*/
00391   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_5_2>>> */
00392   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ERASE_PARAM_BITMASK) != 0)
00393   {
00394     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00395     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_ERASE_PARAM_ERROR,0,NULL);
00396   }
00397   /* Set when only partial address space was erased due to existing
00398    * write protected blocks or the temporary or permanent write protected card
00399    *  was erased.*/
00400   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_5_3>>> */
00401   if (( *CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_WP_ERASE_SKIP_BITMASK) != 0)
00402   {
00403     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00404     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_WP_ERASE_SKIP_ERROR,0,NULL);
00405   }
00406   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00407 }
00408 
00409 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_6>>> */
00410 /*
00411  * This function checks response error types in card's internal error category
00412  */
00413 void SDMMC004_lCheckCardError
00414 (
00415   const uint32_t *CardStatusPtr,
00416   uint8_t *ErrorPtr
00417 )
00418 {
00419   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00420   /* Card internal ECC was applied but failed to correct the data.*/
00421   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_6_1>>> */
00422   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_CARD_ECC_FAILED_BITMASK) != 0)
00423   {
00424     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00425     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_CARD_ECC_ERROR,0,NULL);
00426   }
00427   /* Internal card controller error*/
00428   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_6_2>>> */
00429   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_CC_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00430   {
00431     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00432     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_CC_ERROR,0,NULL);
00433   }
00434   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_6_3>>> */
00435   /* A general or an unknown error occurred during the operation.*/
00436   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00437   {
00438     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00439     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_UNKNOWN_ERROR,0,NULL);
00440   }
00441   /* Debug Log message .*/
00442   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00443 }
00444 
00445 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7>>> */
00446 /*
00447  * This function checks for any error in the command's response received.
00448  */
00449 status_t SDMMC004_lCheckErrorInResponse( const uint32_t *CardStatusPtr)
00450 {
00451   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00452   uint8_t ErrorStatus = 0;      /* No Error */
00453   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00454 
00455   /* Argument Related Error Function */
00456   SDMMC004_lCheckArgumentError( CardStatusPtr, &ErrorStatus );
00457 
00458   /* Erase Related Error function  */
00459   SDMMC004_lCheckEraseError( CardStatusPtr, &ErrorStatus);
00460 
00461   /* Card Related Error function */
00462   SDMMC004_lCheckCardError(CardStatusPtr, &ErrorStatus);
00463 
00464   /* Set when a sequence or password error has been detected in lock/unlock
00465    * card command.*/
00466   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7_1>>> */
00467   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_LOCK_UNLOCK_FAILED_BITMASK) != 0)
00468   {
00469     ErrorStatus = 1UL;
00470     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_LOCK_UNLOCK_ERROR,0,NULL);
00471   }
00472 
00473   /* Can be either one of the following errors:
00474    * The read only section of the CSD does not match the card content.
00475    *  An attempt to reverse the copy  or permanent WP  bits was made.
00476    */
00477   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7_4>>> */
00478   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_CSD_OVERWRITE_BITMASK) != 0)
00479   {
00480     ErrorStatus = 1UL;
00481     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_CSD_OVERWRITE,0,NULL);
00482   }
00483   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7_5>>> */
00484   /* Error in the sequence of the authentication process*/
00485   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ASK_SEQ_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00486   {
00487     ErrorStatus = 1UL;
00488     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_ASK_SEQ_ERROR,0,NULL);
00489   }
00490   /* Below Additional condition is because some SD cards treat CMD55 as Illegal
00491    * Command and gives this error in response */
00492   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7_6>>> */
00493   if (ErrorStatus == 1UL) 
00494   {
00495     Status = (uint32_t) SDMMC004_ERROR;
00496   }
00497   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00498   return Status;
00499 }
00500 
00501 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_41>>> */
00502 /*
00503  * This function checks for lock status of SDMMC card.
00504  */
00505 void SDMMC004_lGetCardLockState(uint32_t CardStatus, uint16_t CommandIndex)
00506 {
00507 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_41_1>>> */
00508   if (((CardStatus & SDMMC004_CSR_CARD_IS_LOCKED_BITMASK) != 0) &&
00509       (CommandIndex != SDMMC004_SEND_RELATIVE_ADDR ))
00510   {
00511     SDMMC004_Handle.State |= SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_LOCKED ;
00512   }
00513 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_41_2>>> */
00514   else
00515   {
00516     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_LOCKED ;
00517   }
00518 }
00519 
00520 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_42>>> */
00521 /*
00522  * This function provide the delay in transfer.
00523  */
00524 status_t SDMMC004_lTransferDelay(uint32_t DelayTime)
00525 {
00526   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00527   SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreIndex = osSemaphoreWait ( \
00528                                     SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreId,\
00529                                     DelayTime);
00530   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_42_1>>> */
00531   if(  SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreIndex < 0)
00532   {
00533     Status = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00534   }
00535   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_42_2>>> */
00536   if( SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError !=  SDMMC004_TRANSFER_COMPLETE)
00537   {
00538     Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError;
00539   }
00540   return Status;
00541 }
00542 
00543 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8>>> */
00544 /*
00545  * This function reads for the response received for the command issued.
00546  */
00547 status_t  SDMMC004_lReadResponse
00548 (
00549   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr,
00550   SDMMC004_ResponseType ResponseType,
00551   void *ResponsePtr
00552 )
00553 {
00554   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
00555   uint32_t ErrorStatus = 0;
00556   uint32_t *TmpPtr;
00557   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00558   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00559   /* Check for  No response type commands */
00560   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_1>>> */
00561   if (CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_GO_IDLE_STATE || \
00562       CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_GO_INACTIVE_STATE)
00563   {
00564     Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00565   }
00566   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_2>>> */
00567   else
00568   {
00569     TmpPtr = (uint32_t *)ResponsePtr;
00570     CardStatus = SDMMC->RESPONSE0;
00571     /* Check Lock Status */
00572   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_3>>> */
00573     SDMMC004_lGetCardLockState(CardStatus, CommandPtr->CommandIndex);
00574     /* Check response type*/
00575     switch( ResponseType )
00576     {
00577     /* Response R1*/
00578     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_4>>> */
00579     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1:
00580       /* check the error bits in the response */
00581       *TmpPtr = CardStatus;
00582       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_5>>> */
00583       Status = SDMMC004_lCheckErrorInResponse(&CardStatus);
00584       break;
00585 
00586       /* Response R1b*/
00587       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_6>>> */
00588     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1b:
00589       *TmpPtr = CardStatus;
00590       /* check the error bits in the response */
00591       Status = SDMMC004_lCheckErrorInResponse(&CardStatus);
00592       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
00593       {
00594         break;
00595       }
00596 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00597       if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TransferInterruptError == TRUE)
00598       {
00599         /* Release the Semaphore */
00600         Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreId);
00601         SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00602       }
00603 #endif  /* SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/
00604 
00605       /*Wait for the transfer complete Interrupt */
00606       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_7>>> */
00607       Status = SDMMC004_lTransferDelay(SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_TRANSFER);
00608       if(Status != (uint32_t) DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
00609       {
00610         ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, Status, 0, NULL);
00611         break;
00612       }
00613 
00614 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00615       if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TransferInterruptError == TRUE)
00616       {
00617         /* Enable the Transfer Complete Status Interrupt */
00618         SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00619         /*  Enable the Transfer Complete Signal Interrupt */
00620         SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00621       }
00622 #endif     /* SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/
00623       break;
00624    /* Response R2*/
00625    /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_8>>> */
00626     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R2:
00627       /* Response register R0-R7 */
00628       *TmpPtr = CardStatus;
00629       TmpPtr++;
00630 
00631       *TmpPtr = SDMMC->RESPONSE2;
00632       TmpPtr++;
00633 
00634       *TmpPtr = SDMMC->RESPONSE4;
00635       TmpPtr++;
00636 
00637       *TmpPtr = SDMMC->RESPONSE6;
00638       break;
00639     /* Response R3*/
00640     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_9>>> */
00641     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R3:
00642       
00643     /* Response R7*/
00644     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_10>>> */
00645     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R7:
00646       *TmpPtr = CardStatus;
00647       break;
00648 
00649     /* Response R6*/
00650     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_11>>> */
00651     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R6:
00652       ErrorStatus  = CardStatus & SDMMC_RESPONSE0_RESPONSE0_Msk;
00653       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_12>>> */
00654       Status = SDMMC004_lCheckErrorInResponse(&ErrorStatus);
00655       /* Read the 16bit RCA received in Response R1 register */
00656       *TmpPtr =(uint16_t)((CardStatus & SDMMC_RESPONSE0_RESPONSE1_Msk) >> \
00657           SDMMC004_HC_RESPONSE1_BITPOS );
00658       break;
00659 
00660     /* No response*/
00661     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_13>>> */
00662     case SDMMC004_NO_RESPONSE:
00663       Status = DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00664       break;
00665 
00666     default:
00667       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
00668       break;
00669     } /* End of " switch( ResponseType )"*/
00670   }/* End of " if (CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_GO_IDLE_STATE ||
00671                CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_GO_INACTIVE_STATE)"*/
00672   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00673   return Status;
00674 }
00675 
00676 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9>>> */
00677 /*
00678  * This function issues the command.
00679  */
00680 status_t SDMMC004_lSendCommand
00681 ( 
00682     const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr,
00683     uint32_t Argument,
00684     SDMMC004_ResponseType ResponseType,
00685     void *ResponsePtr
00686 )
00687 {
00688   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
00689   osStatus SemStatus;
00690   SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort = 0UL;  
00691   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00692   do
00693   {
00694     /*  Take Command Mutex */
00695     SemStatus = osMutexWait(SDMMC004_CmdMutexId,  osWaitForever );
00696     if (osOK != SemStatus)
00697     {
00698       break;
00699     } /* End of " if ((uint32_t)osOK != SemStatus)"*/
00700     SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00701     SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError = SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY;
00702     /* Data or Command line free */
00703     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_1>>>*/
00704     Status = SDMMC004_lCheckDatCmdline(CommandPtr);
00705     if ((Status == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_DATA_LINE_BUSY) ||
00706         (Status == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CMD_LINE_BUSY))
00707     {
00708       break;
00709     }
00710     /* Set argument register */
00711     SDMMC->ARGUMENT1 = Argument;
00712     /* Set command register */
00713     SDMMC->COMMAND = (uint16_t)(*(uint16_t *)CommandPtr);
00714 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00715     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
00716     {
00717       /* Forcefully trigger the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
00718       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0001 ;
00719     }
00720     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_EraseStartError == TRUE)
00721     {
00722       /* Forcefully trigger the Command Index Error Interrupt */
00723       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0008 ;
00724     }
00725     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_EraseEndError == TRUE)
00726     {
00727       /* Forcefully trigger the Command Index Error Interrupt */
00728       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0008 ;
00729     }
00730     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Cmd55Error == TRUE)
00731     {
00732       /* Forcefully trigger the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
00733       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0001 ;
00734     }
00735     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Command42Error == TRUE)
00736     {
00737       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00738     }
00739 #endif  /*SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/   
00740     /* Blocking until any of the bit in the Interrupt Status Register gets set */
00741     SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreIndex = osSemaphoreWait (SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreId,\
00742         SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_COMMAND);
00743     if( SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreIndex < 0)
00744     {
00745       break;
00746     } 
00747     /* Check for any errors */
00748     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_3>>> */
00749     if( SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError == SDMMC004_COMMAND_COMPLETE )
00750     {
00751 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00752       if(Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandResponseError == TRUE)
00753       {
00754         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
00755         break;
00756       }
00757 #endif
00758       /* Read response received. */
00759       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_4>>>*/
00760       Status = SDMMC004_lReadResponse(CommandPtr,ResponseType,ResponsePtr);
00761       break;
00762     }
00763     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_5>>>*/
00764     /* For Cmd8, check for  Command Timeout Interrupt */
00765     else if ((CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_SD_SEND_IF_COND) &&
00766         (SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError == \
00767             SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR))
00768     {
00769       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR;
00770       break;
00771     }
00772 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00773     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
00774     {
00775       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00776       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00777       /* Enable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00778       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00779       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
00780       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
00781     
00782       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
00783       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
00784     
00785       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
00786       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
00787     }
00788     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Cmd55Error == TRUE)
00789     {
00790       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00791       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00792       /* Enable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00793       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00794     
00795       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
00796       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
00797     
00798       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
00799       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
00800     
00801       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
00802       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
00803     }
00804     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Command42Error == TRUE)
00805     {
00806       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00807       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00808       /* Enable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00809       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00810     }
00811 
00812     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_EraseEndError == TRUE)
00813     {
00814       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00815       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00816       /* Enable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00817       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00818     }
00819     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_EraseStartError == TRUE)
00820     {
00821       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00822       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |=  SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00823       /* Disable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00824       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |=  SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk ;
00825     }
00826 #endif  /*SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/
00827 
00828 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00829     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC8Error == TRUE)
00830     {
00831       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00832     }
00833     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC10Error == TRUE)
00834     {
00835       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00836     }
00837     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC13Error == TRUE)
00838     {
00839       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00840     }
00841     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC17Error == TRUE)
00842     {
00843       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00844     }
00845     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC20Error == TRUE)
00846     {
00847       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00848     }
00849 #endif /* SDMMC_UVP_TEST  */
00850 
00851     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_6>>>*/
00852     if (CommandPtr->DataPresentSelect == 1)
00853     {
00854       SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort = 1UL;
00855     }
00856     /* Error Recovery for the failed command  */
00857     Status = SDMMC004_lErrorInterruptRecovery( SDMMC004_ISRContext.InterruptStatusShadow, \
00858                                                SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort);
00859   } while(0);
00860   /*Releasing the Command Semaphore */
00861   if (SemStatus == osOK)
00862   {
00863     SemStatus = osMutexRelease (SDMMC004_CmdMutexId);
00864     if (SemStatus != osOK)
00865     {
00866       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_SENDCOMMAND_ERROR;
00867     } /* End of "if (osOK != SemStatus)"*/
00868   }
00869   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00870   return Status;
00871 }
00872 
00873 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10>>> */
00874 /*
00875  * This function sets the voltage window in OCR register
00876  */
00877 status_t  SDMMC004_lSetVoltageWindow()
00878 {
00879   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
00880   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
00881   uint32_t Argument = 0;
00882   uint32_t LoopCount= 0;
00883   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00884   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10_1>>> */
00885   /* For Standard Capacity Card  */
00886   if (SDMMC004_Handle.f8 == 0)
00887   {
00888     /* Set HCS = 0  */
00889     Argument = SDMMC004_SD_ACMD41_F80_ARG;
00890   }
00891   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10_2>>> */
00892   /* For High Capacity Card */
00893   else
00894   {
00895     /* Set  HCS = 1 */
00896     Argument = SDMMC004_SD_ACMD41_F81_ARG;
00897   }
00898   do
00899   {
00900     /*Send Command55 for Application Specific Command with default RCA as 0*/
00901     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(55)),\
00902                                      SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,\
00903                                      &CardStatus);
00904     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10_3>>> */
00905     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
00906     {
00907       break;
00908     }
00909     /* Send ACMD41 to Set the card's voltage window */
00910     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(62)),\
00911                                     Argument,\
00912                                     SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R3,  \
00913                                     &(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr));
00914     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10_4>>> */
00915     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS && \
00916         (Status != (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ILLEGAL_COMMAND_ERROR))
00917     {
00918       break;
00919     }
00920     Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00921     /* Cards takes some time to set power status bit. Put some delay*/
00922     /* Timeout of 10 ms.*/
00923     SDMMC004_lDelay(SDMMC004_CARD_POWER_DELAY);
00924     /* Check for busy bit in the OCR content i.e response */
00925   } while(!(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr & SDMMC004_OCR_POWER_STATUS_BITMASK) &&\
00926             ( (LoopCount++)<50 ) );
00927   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00928   return Status;
00929 }
00930 
00931 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11>>> */
00932 /*
00933  * This function queries Voltage operating condition of the card.
00934  */
00935 status_t SDMMC004_lQueryOperatingCond()
00936 {
00937   uint32_t ResponseData = 0;
00938   status_t Status;
00939   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00940   /*Query voltage operating condition i.e. cmd8 */
00941   Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(8)),\
00942                                     SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_ARG,SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R7, \
00943                                     &ResponseData );
00944   do
00945   {
00946     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_1>>> */
00947     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
00948     {
00949       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_2>>> */
00950       /*  No response is received for Standard Capacity SD cards or MMC card. */
00951       if (SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError == \
00952           SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR )
00953       {
00954         SDMMC004_Handle.f8 = 0;
00955         Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00956       }
00957       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_3>>> */
00958       else
00959       {
00960         break;
00961       }
00962     }
00963     /* Response received i.e. High Capacity cards. */
00964     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_4>>> */
00965     else
00966     {
00967       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_5>>> */
00968       /* Check whether Check pattern matches in the Argument and Response */
00969       if (( (ResponseData >> SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_CHECK_PATTERN_BITPOS) &\
00970           SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_CHECK_PATTERN_BITMASK) != \
00971           (SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_CHECK_PATTERN_VALUE)
00972       )
00973       {
00974         Status  = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_BAD_RESPONSE;
00975         break;
00976       }
00977       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_6>>> */
00978       /* Check the Voltage Supplied is Accepted by the card in the response  */
00979       if( ((uint8_t)( ResponseData >> SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_VHS_BITPOS) &\
00980           SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_VHS_BITMASK) \
00981           != ( SDMMC004_SD_VHS_PATTERN_2_7_3_6_VALUE ) )
00982       {
00983         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_BAD_RESPONSE;
00984         break;
00985       }
00986       /* Set Flag f8 */
00987       SDMMC004_Handle.f8 = 1;
00988     }
00989   } while(0);
00990   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00991   return Status;
00992 }
00993 
00994 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12>>> */
00995 /*
00996  * This function queries voltage supported from the card.
00997  */
00998 status_t SDMMC004_lQueryVoltage (uint32_t Argument)
00999 {
01000   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01001   status_t Status;
01002   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01003   do
01004   {
01005     /* Send Command55 for Application Specific Command with default RCA as 0*/
01006     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(55)),\
01007         Argument,\
01008         SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,\
01009         &CardStatus);
01010     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_1>>> */
01011     if (Status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01012     {
01013       /* Some SD cards which doen't supports CMD8 treat cmd55 as illegal so
01014        * ignore this error */
01015       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_2>>> */
01016       if (!( (Status == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ILLEGAL_COMMAND_ERROR) &&
01017           (SDMMC004_Handle.f8 == 0) ))
01018       {
01019         break;
01020       }
01021     }
01022     /* Send ACMD41 to query the card's voltage window */
01023     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(62)),Argument,\
01024                                   SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R3,&(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr));
01025     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_3>>> */
01026     if ( (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS) &&\
01027          (Status != (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ILLEGAL_COMMAND_ERROR))
01028     {
01029       /* No response means SDMMC_MMC card */
01030 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01031       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_4>>> */
01032       if (Status == (uint32_t) SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR)
01033       {
01034         Status  =  (uint32_t)SDMMC004_lInitializeMmcCard();
01035         break;
01036       }
01037       else
01038 #endif /* SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD */
01039       {
01040         break;
01041       }
01042     }
01043     /* Send ACMD41 with voltage window argument set */
01044     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_5>>> */
01045     Status = SDMMC004_lSetVoltageWindow();
01046     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01047     {
01048       break;
01049     }
01050     /* SD Card Type */
01051     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_6>>> */
01052     SDMMC004_lWriteCardType();
01053   } while(0);
01054   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01055   return Status;
01056 }
01057 
01058 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_13>>> */
01059 /*
01060  * This function reads the card registers after the card is initialized.
01061  */
01062 status_t SDMMC004_lAfterCardInitialize()
01063 {
01064   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01065   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01066   do
01067   {
01068     /* Read CSD & SCR Register & Card Write Protection Flags. */
01069     Status = SDMMC004_lReadCardRegisters();
01070     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_13_1>>> */
01071     if(Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01072     {
01073       break;
01074     }
01075 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_4_BUS_WIDTH
01076     /* Switch  to 4-bit bus width if supported */
01077     Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchBusWidth();
01078     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_13_2>>> */
01079     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01080     {
01081       /* Change bus width to default in the Host Controller */
01082       CLR_BIT( SDMMC->HOST_CTRL,SDMMC_HOST_CTRL_DATA_TX_WIDTH_Pos);
01083     }
01084     /* Switch  to High Speed Mode */
01085     Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchSpeed();
01086     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_13_3>>> */
01087     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01088     {
01089       /* Change Speed mode to default in the Host Controller */
01090       CLR_BIT( SDMMC->HOST_CTRL,SDMMC_HOST_CTRL_HIGH_SPEED_EN_Pos );
01091       Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01092     }
01093 #endif
01094   } while(0);
01095   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01096   return Status;
01097 }
01098 
01099 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14>>> */
01100 /*
01101  * This function initializes the SD card.
01102  */
01103 status_t SDMMC004_lInitializeCard()
01104 {
01105   status_t Status;
01106   uint32_t LockStatus ;
01107   uint8_t Count= 0;
01108   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01109   do
01110   {
01111     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_1>>> */
01112     /* Repeat the below steps 2 times if bad response is received.    */
01113     do
01114     {
01115       /* Reset the card. i.e cmd0 */
01116       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(0)), \
01117                                       SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,SDMMC004_NO_RESPONSE, \
01118                                       NULL);
01119       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_2>>> */
01120       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01121       {
01122         break;
01123       }
01124       /* Query the Operation Condition Info from the card.*/
01125       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_3>>> */
01126       Status = SDMMC004_lQueryOperatingCond();
01127       Count++;
01128     } while(( Count < SDMMC004_NUM_CARD_RESET_RETRIES) && \
01129             ( Status == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_BAD_RESPONSE));
01130     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_4>> */
01131     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01132     {
01133       break;
01134     }
01135     /* Query & Set voltage window  */
01136     Status = SDMMC004_lQueryVoltage(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca);
01137     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_5>> */
01138     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01139     {
01140       break;
01141     }
01142     /* Read CID */
01143     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand(&(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(2)), \
01144                                    SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R2, \
01145                                    (void *)SDMMC004_CardInfo.CidArray);
01146     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_6>> */
01147     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01148     {
01149       break;
01150     }
01151     /* Read RCA */
01152     Status = SDMMC004_lReadRca();
01153     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_7>> */
01154     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01155     {
01156       break;
01157     } 
01158     /* Check the card Lock/ Unlock Status */
01159     Status = SDMMC004_GetLockStatus(&LockStatus);
01160     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_8>> */
01161     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01162     {
01163       break;
01164     }
01165     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_9>> */
01166     if (LockStatus == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CARD_IS_LOCKED)
01167     {
01168       SDMMC004_Handle.State |= SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_LOCKED ;
01169       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_INITIALIZED_BUT_LOCKED;     
01170     }
01171     /* Update card initialization Status */
01172     SDMMC004_Handle.State |= SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_INITIALIZED;
01173     SDMMC004_Handle.State &=  ~(SDMMC004_STATE_NO_CARD);
01174   } while(0);
01175   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01176   return Status;
01177 }
01178 
01179 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15>>> */
01180 /*
01181  * This function finds out the card Type information.
01182  */
01183 void SDMMC004_lWriteCardType()
01184 {
01185   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01186   /* If F8 =0 , Standard Capacity V1 Card */
01187   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15_1>>> */
01188   if ( SDMMC004_Handle.f8 == 0)
01189   {
01190     SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_SD_STANDARD_CAPACITY_V1x;
01191   }
01192   /* If F8 =1 , Standard Capacity V2 or High Capacity Card */
01193   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15_2>>> */
01194   else
01195   {
01196     /* Check CCS bit in the OCR register, CCS=1 means High Capacity  card*/
01197     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15_3>>> */
01198     if ((SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr & SDMMC004_OCR_CCS_BITMASK ) != 0)
01199     {
01200       SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_SD_HIGH_CAPACITY | \
01201           SDMMC004_BLOCK_ADDRESSING;
01202     }
01203     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15_4>>> */
01204     /* CCS=0 means Standard Capacity Version2*/
01205     else
01206     {
01207       SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_SD_STANDARD_CAPACITY_V2;
01208     }
01209   }
01210   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01211 }
01212 
01213 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16>>> */
01214 /*
01215  * This function finds out the Write protection status of the card.
01216  */
01217 status_t SDMMC004_lSetWriteProtect (void)
01218 {
01219   uint32_t SdStatus[16] = {0};
01220   uint32_t WriteProtect;
01221   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01222   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01223   do
01224   {
01225 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01226     SDMMC004_MMCCSDType *TmpMmcCsdPtr;
01227     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16_1>>> */
01228     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) != 0)
01229     {
01230       TmpMmcCsdPtr = (SDMMC004_MMCCSDType *)&SDMMC004_CardInfo.CsdArray;
01231       /* Read Write Protection bits from CSD Register i.e both Temp & Permanent */
01232       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16_2>>> */
01233       if ( ((TmpMmcCsdPtr->TempWriteProtect) != 0) ||
01234           ((TmpMmcCsdPtr->PermWriteProtect) != 0))
01235       {
01236         SDMMC004_Handle.State |=(uint32_t)SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_WRITE_PROTECT;
01237       }
01238     }
01239     else
01240 #endif
01241     {
01242       /* SD Card Write Protection.  */
01243       Status  = SDMMC004_GetSdStatus((void*)&(SdStatus[0]));
01244       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16_3>>> */
01245       if (Status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01246       {
01247         break;
01248       }
01249       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16_4>>> */
01250       /* Bits 480:495 in the SD status gives the Write Protection Information */
01251       WriteProtect = ((SdStatus[0] & 0xFF000000) >> 24 ) | 
01252           (((SdStatus[0] & 0x00FF0000) >> 16 ) << 8) ;
01253       if ( (WriteProtect & SDMMC004_SD_CARD_TYPE_BITMASK) != 0 )
01254       {
01255         SDMMC004_Handle.State |=(uint32_t)SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_WRITE_PROTECT;
01256       }
01257     }
01258   } while(0);
01259   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01260   return Status;
01261 }
01262 
01263 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_17>>> */
01264 /*
01265  * This function reads the  Relative card address of the card.
01266  */
01267 status_t SDMMC004_lReadRca()
01268 {
01269   status_t Status ;
01270 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01271   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01272 #endif /* SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD */
01273   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01274   /*  Read RCA for MMC card */
01275 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01276   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_17_1>>> */
01277   if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) != 0)
01278   {
01279     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(3)),\
01280             (uint32_t)SDMMC004_MMC_DEFAULT_RCA, SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,&CardStatus);
01281     SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca = SDMMC004_MMC_DEFAULT_RCA;
01282   }
01283   /*  Read RCA for SD  */
01284   else
01285 #endif
01286   {
01287     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_17_2>>> */
01288     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(3)), \
01289                                       SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0, \
01290                                       SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R6, \
01291                                      &(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca));
01292                                   }
01293   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01294   return Status;
01295 }
01296 
01297 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_18>>> */
01298 /*
01299  * This function initializes the MMC card.
01300  */
01301 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01302 /* SDMMC_MMC Initialize */
01303 status_t SDMMC004_lInitializeMmcCard()
01304 {
01305   status_t Status;
01306   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01307   do
01308   {
01309     /* Reset the card. i.e cmd0 */
01310     Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(0)), \
01311                                               SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,  \
01312                                               SDMMC004_NO_RESPONSE, NULL);
01313     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_18_1>>> */
01314     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01315     {
01316       break;
01317     }
01318     /*Command1 indicating support for high capacity cards & voltage 2.7 to 3.6v */
01319     do
01320     {
01321       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand(&(SDMMC004_MMC_COMMAND(1)), \
01322                                       MMC_CMD1_ARG ,SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R3,\
01323                                       &(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr) );
01324       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_18_2>>> */
01325       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01326       {
01327         break;
01328       }/* End of "if(Status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS )" */
01329     } while(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr & SDMMC004_OCR_POWER_STATUS_BITMASK );
01330 
01331     /* Check mode. 00b (byte mode) & 10b (sector mode)*/
01332     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_18_3>>> */
01333     if( ((SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr & SDMMC004_MMC_OCR_ACCESS_MODE_BITMASK) >> \
01334         (SDMMC004_MMC_OCR_ACCESS_MODE_BITPOS) != 0))
01335     {
01336       SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_BLOCK_ADDRESSING;
01337     }
01338     SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_MMC;
01339   } while(0);
01340   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01341   return Status;
01342 }
01343 #endif
01344 
01345 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19>>> */
01346 /*
01347  * This function reads the CSD, SCR and Write protection status of the card.
01348  */
01349 status_t SDMMC004_lReadCardRegisters (void)
01350 {
01351   uint32_t Argument = 0;
01352   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01353   status_t Status;
01354   SDMMC004_SCRType ScrContent = {0};
01355   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01356   do
01357   {
01358     /* Read CSD Register  */
01359     Argument |= SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca << SDMMC004_ARG_RCA_BITPOS;
01360     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(9)),Argument, \
01361                                       SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R2, \
01362                                       (void *)SDMMC004_CardInfo.CsdArray);
01363     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_1>>> */
01364     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01365     {
01366       break;
01367     }
01368     /* Set Write protection flags */
01369     Status = SDMMC004_lSetWriteProtect();
01370     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_2>>> */
01371     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01372     {
01373       break;
01374     }
01375     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_3>>> */
01376     /* Read SCR register for SD card */
01377     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) == 0)
01378     {
01379       /* Switch to Transferring State. */
01380       Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchToTransferState();
01381       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_4>>> */
01382       if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01383       {
01384         break;
01385       }
01386       /*Send the Application Specific Command i.e. Command 55.*/
01387       Argument |= SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca << SDMMC004_ARG_RCA_BITPOS;
01388       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(55)), \
01389                                         Argument, SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, \
01390                                         &CardStatus );
01391       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_5>>> */
01392       if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01393       {
01394         break;
01395       }
01396       /* Set Direction Select bit in the Transfer Mode register */
01397       SET_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_TX_DIR_SELECT_Pos);
01398       /* Read the transferred SCR data*/
01399       Status = SDMMC004_lSingleBlockTransfer( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(64)), \
01400                                                 SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,8, \
01401                                                 (uint32_t *)&ScrContent, \
01402                                                 SDMMC004_READ_FROM_BUFF);
01403       SDMMC004_CardInfo.Scr = ScrContent;
01404       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_6>>> */
01405       if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01406       {
01407         break;
01408       }
01409     } /* End of " if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) == 0)"*/
01410   } while(0);
01411   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01412   return Status;
01413 }
01414 
01415 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_20>>> */
01416 /*
01417  * This function configures the registers for Single Block Transfer.
01418  */
01419 status_t SDMMC004_lConfigureForSingleTransfer
01420 (
01421   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr,
01422   uint32_t Argument,
01423   uint16_t BlockSize
01424 )
01425 {
01426   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01427   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01428   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01429   do
01430   {
01431     /* Set Block Size Register */
01432     WR_REG( SDMMC->BLOCK_SIZE,SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_Msk , \
01433             SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_Pos,BlockSize );
01434     /* Clear the Multi Block Select bit */
01435     CLR_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_MULTI_BLOCK_SELECT_Pos);
01436     /* Clear the ACMD Enable bit*/
01437     CLR_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_ACMD_EN_Pos);
01438     /* Clear the Block Count Enable bit*/
01439     CLR_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_BLOCK_COUNT_EN_Pos);
01440 
01441 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
01442     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC13Error == TRUE)
01443     {
01444       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt =TRUE ;
01445     }
01446     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC20Error == TRUE)
01447     {
01448       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt =TRUE ;
01449     }
01450 
01451     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Command42Error == TRUE)
01452     {
01453       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt =TRUE ;
01454     }
01455     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01456     {
01457       /* Disable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
01458       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01459       /* Disable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
01460       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~( SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01461 
01462       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01463       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01464       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01465       /* Disable the Buffer Write  Status & Signal Interrupt */
01466       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01467       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01468       /* Disable the Transfer Complete  Status & Signal Interrupt */
01469       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01470       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01471     }
01472     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01473     {
01474       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01475       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01476       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01477       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01478       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01479       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01480     }
01481 #endif
01482     /* Send Single Block Transfer Command */
01483     Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_lSendCommand( CommandPtr, Argument, \
01484                                               SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,&CardStatus);
01485     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_20_1>>> */
01486     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01487     {
01488       break;
01489     }
01490   } while(0);
01491   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01492   return Status;
01493 }
01494 
01495 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_21>>> */
01496 /*
01497  * This function configures the registers for Multiple Block Transfer.
01498  */
01499 status_t SDMMC004_lConfigureRegForMultiTransfer
01500 (
01501   uint32_t *TmpAddrPtr,
01502   uint32_t NumberOfBlocks,
01503   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr
01504 )
01505 {
01506   status_t Status;
01507   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01508   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01509   do
01510   {
01511     /* Block Addressing */
01512     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_21_1>>> */
01513     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_BLOCK_ADDRESSING) == 0UL)
01514     {
01515       *TmpAddrPtr *= 512UL;
01516     }
01517     /* Set Block Size Register */
01518     WR_REG( SDMMC->BLOCK_SIZE,SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_Msk ,  \
01519             SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_Pos,SDMMC004_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_VALUE);
01520     /* Set Transfer Mode Register */
01521     SET_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_MULTI_BLOCK_SELECT_Pos);
01522     SET_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_ACMD_EN_Pos);
01523     SET_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_BLOCK_COUNT_EN_Pos);
01524 
01525     /* Set Block Count Register */
01526     WR_REG( SDMMC->BLOCK_COUNT, SDMMC_BLOCK_COUNT_BLOCK_COUNT_Msk ,\
01527             SDMMC_BLOCK_COUNT_BLOCK_COUNT_Pos, NumberOfBlocks);
01528 
01529     /* Enable ACMD 12 Interrupt Signal  */
01530     SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR &= ~SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR_ACMD_ERR_EN_Msk;
01531     SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR_ACMD_ERR_EN_Msk;
01532 
01533 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST 
01534     if ( Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC8Error == TRUE)
01535     {
01536       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = TRUE;
01537     }
01538     if ( Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC10Error == TRUE)
01539     {
01540       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = TRUE;
01541     }
01542     if ( Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC17Error == TRUE)
01543     {
01544       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = TRUE;
01545     }
01546     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01547     {
01548       /* Disable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
01549       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01550       /* Disable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
01551       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~( SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01552       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01553       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01554       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01555       /* Disable the Buffer Write Status & Signal Interrupt */
01556       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01557       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01558       /* Disable the Transfer Complete Status & Signal Interrupt */
01559       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01560       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01561     }
01562     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01563     {
01564       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01565       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01566       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01567 
01568       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01569       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01570       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01571     }
01572 #endif
01573     /* Send Multiple Block  Transfer Command */
01574     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( CommandPtr, *TmpAddrPtr, \
01575                                     SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, &CardStatus );
01576     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_21_2>>> */
01577     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01578     {
01579       break;
01580     }
01581   } while(0);
01582   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01583   return Status;
01584 }
01585 
01586 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22>>> */
01587 /*
01588  * This function is used to transfer multiple blocks of data.
01589  */
01590 status_t SDMMC004_lMultiBlockTransfer 
01591 (
01592   uint32_t *AddrPtr, uint32_t NumberOfBlocks,\
01593   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr, \
01594   uint32_t *BufferPtr, SDMMC004_DataTrasferType TransferMode
01595 )
01596 {
01597   status_t Status ;
01598   SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
01599   do
01600   {
01601     SDMMC004_BufferPtr = BufferPtr;
01602     SDMMC004_TransferQuadBytes = SDMMC004_NUM_QUADLETS_IN_BLOCK;
01603     SDMMC004_BlockCount = NumberOfBlocks;
01604     /* Configure Registers for Multi block transfer*/
01605     Status = SDMMC004_lConfigureRegForMultiTransfer( AddrPtr, NumberOfBlocks, \
01606                                                     CommandPtr );
01607     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_1>>> */
01608     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01609     {
01610       break;
01611     }
01612 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
01613     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01614     {
01615       /* Forcefully trigger the Data Crc Error Interrupt */
01616       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0020 ;
01617     }
01618 #endif
01619     /* Read/Write Transfer will be done in when buffer ready interrupt comes  */
01620     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_2>>> */
01621     Status = SDMMC004_lDataTransfer();
01622     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_3>>> */
01623     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01624     {
01625       break;
01626     }
01627     /* Block on Transfer Complete Interrupt */
01628     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_4>>> */
01629     /* Timeout of 1ms.*/
01630     Status = SDMMC004_lTransferDelay(SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_TRANSFER);
01631     if(Status != (uint32_t) DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01632     {
01633       ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, Status, 0, NULL);
01634       break;
01635     }
01636     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_5>>> */
01637     /* Check ACMD status*/
01638     if (SDMMC004_Handle.AcmdInterruptError == SDMMC004_ACMD12_ERROR)
01639     {
01640       /* Call ACMD12 Error Recovery */
01641       SDMMC004_lAcmdErrorRecovery();
01642     }
01643   } while(0);
01644   return Status;
01645 }
01646 
01647 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23>>> */
01648 /*
01649  * This function performs the  Single Block Transfer.
01650  */
01651 status_t SDMMC004_lSingleBlockTransfer
01652 (
01653   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr,
01654   uint32_t Argument,
01655   uint16_t BlockSize,
01656   uint32_t *BufferPtr,
01657   SDMMC004_DataTrasferType TransferMode
01658 )
01659 {
01660   status_t Status;
01661   SDMMC004_BufferPtr = BufferPtr;
01662   SDMMC004_TransferQuadBytes = BlockSize/4;
01663   SDMMC004_BlockCount = 1;
01664   do
01665   {
01666     /* Configure Register  for Single Block Transfer */
01667     Status = SDMMC004_lConfigureForSingleTransfer(CommandPtr,Argument,BlockSize);
01668     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23_1>>> */
01669     if ((uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS != Status)
01670     {
01671       break;
01672     }
01673 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
01674     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01675     {
01676       /* Forcefully trigger the Data Crc Error Interrupt */
01677       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0020 ;
01678     }
01679 #endif
01680     /* Data transfer will be done in Buffer ready interrupt routine*/
01681     Status = SDMMC004_lDataTransfer();
01682     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23_2>>> */
01683     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01684     {
01685       break;
01686     }
01687     /* Block on Transfer Complete Interrupt */
01688     SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreIndex = osSemaphoreWait ( \
01689                                       SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreId,\
01690                                       SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_TRANSFER);
01691     if(   SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreIndex < 0)
01692     { 
01693       break;
01694     } 
01695     /* Check Transfer Complete Status */
01696     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23_4>>> */
01697     if (SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError == SDMMC004_TRANSFER_COMPLETE )
01698     {
01699       Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01700     }
01701     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23_5>>> */
01702     else
01703     {
01704       SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort = 1;
01705       Status = SDMMC004_lErrorInterruptRecovery(\
01706                          SDMMC004_ISRContext.InterruptStatusShadow, \
01707                          SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort);
01708       break;
01709     }
01710   } while(0);
01711   return Status;
01712 }
01713 
01714 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_24>>> */
01715 /*
01716  * This function checks the Lock Status .
01717  */
01718 status_t SDMMC004_lCheckLockStatus( SDMMC004_CardLockMode OperationMode )
01719 {
01720   status_t Status ;
01721   uint32_t LockStatus = 0;
01722   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01723   Status =  SDMMC004_GetLockStatus(&LockStatus);
01724   /* For Lock, Card State must be locked */
01725   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_24_1>>> */
01726   if (Status == (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01727   {
01728     if( (LockStatus == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CARD_IS_LOCKED) && \
01729         (OperationMode == SDMMC004_LOCK)
01730        )
01731     {
01732       Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01733     }
01734     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_24_2>>> */
01735     /* For UnLock, Card State must be unlock */
01736     else if( (LockStatus == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CARD_UNLOCKED) && \
01737         (OperationMode == SDMMC004_UNLOCK)
01738     )
01739     {
01740       Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01741     }
01742     /* Some Error */
01743     else
01744     {
01745       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_LOCK_UNLOCK_ERROR;
01746     }
01747   }
01748   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01749   return Status;
01750 }
01751 
01752 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25>>> */
01753 /*
01754  * This function switches the bus width to 4-bit if is supported.
01755  */
01756 status_t SDMMC004_lSwitchBusWidth(void)
01757 {
01758   uint32_t Argument = 0;
01759   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01760   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01761   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01762   do
01763   {
01764     /* Switch to transfer state i.e. CMD7 */
01765     Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchToTransferState();
01766     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_1>>> */
01767     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01768     {
01769       break;
01770     }
01771     /* Disable Card Interrupt */
01772     CLR_BIT( SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM, SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_INS_EN_Pos );
01773     /* MMC Card */
01774     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_2>>> */
01775 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01776     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) != 0)
01777     {
01778       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand(&(SDMMC004_MMC_COMMAND(6)),\
01779                                       MMC_4BUS_WIDTH_ARG,\
01780                                       SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, &CardStatus);
01781       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_3>>> */
01782       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01783       {
01784         break;
01785       }
01786     }
01787     /* SD card */
01788     else
01789 #endif /* SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD*/
01790     {
01791       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_4>>> */
01792       /* Check the Data Transfer width supported in SCR Register */
01793       if( !(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Scr.SdBusWidth & SDMMC004_SCR_BUS_WIDTH4_BITMASK))
01794       {
01795         break;
01796       }
01797       /* Set the Argument.*/
01798       Argument |= SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca << SDMMC004_ARG_RCA_BITPOS;
01799       /* Send Application Specific Command */
01800       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(55)), \
01801           Argument, \
01802           SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, \
01803           &CardStatus);
01804       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_5>>> */
01805       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01806       {
01807         break;
01808       }
01809       /* Send ACMD6 to switch the bus width. */
01810       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(58)), \
01811           SDMMC004_SD_4BUS_WIDTH_ARG, \
01812           SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, \
01813           &CardStatus);
01814       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_6>>> */
01815       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01816       {
01817         break;
01818       }
01819     }
01820     /* Set Data Transfer Width  in Host Control Register. */
01821     SET_BIT( SDMMC->HOST_CTRL,SDMMC_HOST_CTRL_DATA_TX_WIDTH_Pos);
01822   } while(0);
01823   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01824   return Status;
01825 }
01826 
01827 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26>>> */
01828 /*
01829  * This function switches the card speed to high speed  if is supported.
01830  */
01831 status_t SDMMC004_lSwitchSpeed( void)
01832 {
01833 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01834   uint32_t CardStatus;
01835 #endif
01836   uint32_t SwitchStatus[16] = {0 };
01837   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01838   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01839   do
01840   {
01841 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01842     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_1>>> */
01843     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) != 0)
01844     {
01845       /* Switch to transfer state i.e. CMD7 */
01846       Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchToTransferState();
01847       if( Status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01848       {
01849         break;
01850       }
01851       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand(&(SDMMC004_MMC_COMMAND(6)),\
01852                                       MMC_HIGH_SPEED_ARG,\
01853                                       SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,&CardStatus);
01854       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01855       {
01856         break;
01857       }
01858     }
01859     /* SD card */
01860     else
01861 #endif /* SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD */
01862     {
01863       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_2>>> */
01864       /* Check CMD6 support in SCR register*/
01865       if ( SDMMC004_CardInfo.Scr.SdSpec == 0 )
01866       {
01867         break;
01868       }
01869       /* Switch to transfer state i.e. CMD7 */
01870       Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchToTransferState();
01871       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_3>>> */
01872       if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01873       {
01874         break;
01875       }
01876       /* Send the Switch function  command and read the transferred block of
01877        * data from the card */
01878       Status = SDMMC004_lSingleBlockTransfer( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(6)), \
01879                                               SDMMC004_SD_HIGH_SPEED_ARG,64, \
01880                                               (uint32_t*)SwitchStatus, \
01881                                                SDMMC004_READ_FROM_BUFF
01882                                              );
01883       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_4>>> */
01884       if ( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01885       {
01886         break;
01887       }
01888       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_5>>> */
01889       if ( ((SwitchStatus[4] & SDMMC004_SWITCH_FUNC_GRP1_STATUS_BITMASK) >> \
01890           SDMMC004_SWITCH_FUNC_GRP1_STATUS_BITPOS) != 1UL )
01891       {
01892         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01893         break;
01894       }
01895       /* Change Speed mode in the Host Controller */
01896       SET_BIT( SDMMC->HOST_CTRL,SDMMC_HOST_CTRL_HIGH_SPEED_EN_Pos );
01897     }
01898   } while(0);
01899   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01900   return Status;
01901 }
01902 
01903 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27>>> */
01904 /*
01905  * This function performs the recovery task if any error interrupt occurs.
01906  */
01907 status_t SDMMC004_lErrorInterruptRecovery
01908 (
01909   uint16_t InterruptStatus,
01910   uint8_t IssueAbort
01911 )
01912 {
01913   status_t Status =  (uint32_t)SDMMC004_NONRECOVERABLE_ERROR;
01914   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01915   do
01916   {
01917     /* Disable the Error Interrupt Signal  */
01918     SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR = 0;
01919     /* Check Error Interrupt Status bits D0-D3 for CMD line errors */
01920     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_1>>> */
01921     if ( ((InterruptStatus & SDMMC004_ERROR_CMD_STATUS_BITMASK) != 0 ) || \
01922         ( SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_COMMAND_INHIBIT_CMD_Msk ))
01923     {
01924       /* Set Software Reset for CMD Line  */
01925       Status = SDMMC004_lReset(SDMMC_SW_RESET_SW_RST_CMD_LINE_Msk);
01926     }
01927     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_2>>> */
01928     /* Check Error Interrupt Status bits D4-D6 for Data line errors */
01929     if ( ((InterruptStatus & SDMMC004_ERROR_DATA_STATUS_BITMASK) != 0 ) ||  \
01930         ( SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_COMMAND_INHIBIT_DAT_Msk ))
01931     {
01932       /*  Set Software Reset for Data Line */
01933       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_3>>> */
01934       Status = SDMMC004_lReset( SDMMC_SW_RESET_SW_RST_DAT_LINE_Msk);
01935     }
01936     /*  Clear previous error status  */
01937     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_ERR = SDMMC004_ALL_ERROR_STATUS_BITMASK ;
01938     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_4>>>  */
01939     if (IssueAbort == 1)
01940     {   
01941       /*  Issue Abort Command.  */
01942       /*  Set argument register */
01943       SDMMC->ARGUMENT1 = SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0;
01944       /*  Set command register */
01945       SDMMC->COMMAND = (uint16_t)(*(uint16_t*)&(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(12)));  
01946       /* Take the semaphores  */
01947       SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreIndex = osSemaphoreWait(SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreId,\
01948                                                 SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_COMMAND);
01949       /* <<< DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_5 >>> */
01950       if( SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreIndex < 0)
01951       {
01952         break;
01953       }  
01954       /* If error status bit is set in the Status register */
01955       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_6>>> */
01956       if (SDMMC->INT_STATUS_ERR )
01957       {
01958         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_NONRECOVERABLE_ERROR;
01959         SDMMC->INT_STATUS_ERR = SDMMC004_ALL_ERROR_STATUS_BITMASK ;
01960         SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC004_ALL_ERROR_STATUS_BITMASK ;
01961         /* Set Software Reset for CMD Line and Data Line  */
01962         SDMMC004_ReturnStatus = SDMMC004_lReset(SDMMC_SW_RESET_SW_RST_CMD_LINE_Msk | \
01963                                            SDMMC_SW_RESET_SW_RST_DAT_LINE_Msk );
01964         break;
01965       }
01966     }
01967     /* Check Data lines status in present status register  */
01968     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_7>>> */
01969     if (( (SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_DAT_3_0_PIN_LEVEL_Msk) >> \
01970         SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_DAT_3_0_PIN_LEVEL_Pos) == SDMMC004_ALL_DATA_LINES_HIGH)
01971     {
01972       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_RECOVERABLE_ERROR;
01973     }
01974     else
01975     {
01976       Status =  (uint32_t)SDMMC004_NONRECOVERABLE_ERROR;
01977     }
01978   } while(0);
01979   /* Enable the Error Interrupt signal */
01980   SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR |= SDMMC004_ERROR_INT_SIGNAL_ENABLE;
01981   /* Global Error Recovery Variable */
01982   SDMMC004_Handle.ErrorRecoveryStatus = (SDMMC004_ErrorCodesType)Status;
01983   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01984   return Status;
01985 }
01986 
01987 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28>>> */
01988 /*
01989  * This function handles the Interrupt in Normal Interrupt Status Register.
01990  */
01991 status_t SDMMC004_lNormalInterruptHandler( uint16_t IntStatus)
01992 {
01993   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01994   uint32_t Count;
01995   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01996 #if SDMMC_CARD_DETECTION_SUPPORT
01997   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_1>>> */
01998   /* CARD REMOVAL INTERRUPT */
01999   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_REMOVAL_Msk) != 0)
02000   {
02001     /* Confirm that the Card Insertion bit is clear in Present State Status*/
02002     do
02003     {
02004     } while(( SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE &  SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_CARD_INSERTED_Msk)!= 0);
02005     /* Clear the Interrupt Status bit */
02006     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_REMOVAL_Msk;
02007  
02008     /* Call back to upper layer function for card removal interrupt*/
02009     if (SDMMC004_Handle.CallBackPtr != NULL)
02010     {
02011       SDMMC004_Handle.CallBackPtr(SDMMC004_CARD_REMOVAL); 
02012     }
02013     else
02014     {
02015       Status = SDMMC004_NULL_POINTER;
02016       ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, Status,0,0);
02017     }
02018 
02019   }
02020   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_2>>> */
02021   /* CARD INSERTION INTERRUPT */
02022   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_INS_Msk) != 0)
02023   {
02024     /* Confirm that the Card Insertion bit is set in Present State Status*/
02025     do
02026     {
02027     } while((SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_CARD_INSERTED_Msk) == 0);
02028     /* Clear the Interrupt Status */
02029     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_INS_Msk;
02030 
02031     /* Call back to upper layer function for card insertion interrupt*/
02032     if (SDMMC004_Handle.CallBackPtr != NULL)
02033     {
02034       SDMMC004_Handle.CallBackPtr(SDMMC004_CARD_INSERTION); 
02035     }
02036     else
02037     {
02038       Status = SDMMC004_NULL_POINTER;
02039       ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, Status,0,0);
02040     }
02041   }
02042 #endif
02043   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_3>>> */
02044   /* BUFFER READ READY INTERRUPT */
02045   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_Msk) != 0)
02046   {
02047     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02048     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_Msk;
02049     /* Update the Global Variable */
02050     SDMMC004_Handle.BufferReadyInterruptStatus = SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY;
02051     /* Check the global variable for any error in the block transfer */
02052     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_4>>> */
02053     if ( SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError == SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY)
02054     {
02055       for (Count=0; Count<SDMMC004_TransferQuadBytes; Count++)
02056       {
02057         *SDMMC004_BufferPtr  = SDMMC->DATA_BUFFER;
02058         SDMMC004_BufferPtr++;
02059       }
02060       SDMMC004_BlockCount--;
02061     }
02062     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_5>>> */
02063     /* Check Block Count */
02064     if (SDMMC004_BlockCount == 0)
02065     {
02066       /* Release the Semaphore */
02067       Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_DataSemaphoreId);
02068     }
02069   }
02070 
02071   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_5>>> */
02072   /* BUFFER WRITE READY INTERRUPT */
02073   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_Msk) != 0)
02074   {
02075 
02076     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02077     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_Msk;
02078     /* Update the Global Variable */
02079     SDMMC004_Handle.BufferReadyInterruptStatus  = SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY;
02080     /* Check the global variable for any error in the block transfer */
02081     if ( SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError == SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY)
02082     {
02083       for (Count=0; Count<SDMMC004_TransferQuadBytes; Count++)
02084       {
02085         SDMMC->DATA_BUFFER = *SDMMC004_BufferPtr;
02086         SDMMC004_BufferPtr++;
02087       }
02088       SDMMC004_BlockCount--;
02089     }
02090     if (SDMMC004_BlockCount == 0)
02091     {
02092       /* Release the Semaphore */
02093       Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_DataSemaphoreId);
02094     }
02095   }
02096   
02097   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_6>>> */
02098   /* TRANSFER COMPLETE INTERRUPT */
02099   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_Msk ) != 0)
02100   {
02101     /* Update the Global Variable */
02102     SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError = SDMMC004_TRANSFER_COMPLETE;
02103     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02104     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_Msk;
02105     /* Change the data line Status  to be free */
02106     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_DATA_ACTIVE;
02107     /* Release the Semaphore */
02108     Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreId);
02109   }
02110   
02111   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_7>>> */
02112   /* COMMAND COMPLETE INTERRUPT */
02113   if ((IntStatus &  SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_Msk) != 0)
02114   {
02115     /* Update the Global Variable */
02116     SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_COMMAND_COMPLETE;
02117     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02118     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_Msk;
02119     /* Change the Command Line Status to free */
02120     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_CMD_ACTIVE;
02121     /* Release the Semaphore */
02122     Status =osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreId);
02123   }
02124   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
02125   return (uint32_t)Status;
02126 }
02127 
02128 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_29>>> */
02129 /*
02130  * This function handles the Interrupt in Error Interrupt Status Register.
02131  */
02132 
02133 status_t SDMMC004_lErrorInterruptHandler(uint16_t IntStatus)
02134 {
02135   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
02136 
02137   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
02138   SDMMC004_ISRContext.InterruptStatusShadow = IntStatus;
02139   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_29_1>>> */
02140   /* COMMAND TIMEOUT ERROR INTERRUPT */
02141   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_ERR_CMD_TIMEOUT_ERR_Msk)!= 0)
02142   {
02143     /* Update the Global Variable */
02144     SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR;
02145     /* Change the Command Line Status to free */
02146     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_CMD_ACTIVE;
02147 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
02148     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
02149     {
02150       /* Forcefully disable the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
02151       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0000 ;
02152     }
02153     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Cmd55Error == TRUE)
02154     {
02155       /* Forcefully disable the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
02156       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0000 ;
